pxchat.net.tcp
Interface TCPClientListener

All Known Subinterfaces:
TCPServerListener
public interface TCPClientListener

The TCPClientListener interface contains the callbacks used to react to client events.

Author:
Markus DÃ¶llinger

Method Summary
 void clientClearToSend(CustomSocket client)
          This method is called when a write operation to the socket has successfully ended.
 void clientConnect(CustomSocket client)
          This method is called when the client connected.
 void clientConnecting(CustomSocket client)
          This method is called when the client is connecting.
 void clientDisconnect(CustomSocket client)
          This method is called when the client disconnects.
 void clientRead(CustomSocket client, java.lang.Object data)
          This method is called when the client receives data.
 

Method Detail

clientClearToSend

void clientClearToSend(CustomSocket client)
This method is called when a write operation to the socket has successfully ended. This event may be used to transfer huge amounts of data in the background, i.e. images.

Parameters:
client - The source of the event

clientConnect

void clientConnect(CustomSocket client)
This method is called when the client connected.

Parameters:
client - The source of the event

clientConnecting

void clientConnecting(CustomSocket client)
This method is called when the client is connecting.

Parameters:
client - The source of the event

clientDisconnect

void clientDisconnect(CustomSocket client)
This method is called when the client disconnects.

Parameters:
client - The source of the event

clientRead

void clientRead(CustomSocket client,
                java.lang.Object data)
This method is called when the client receives data.

Parameters:
client - The source of the event
data - The data received
